content.question: Oil is spilled onto a kitchen floor. The area covered by the oil at time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by the function <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="A, of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in square centimeters and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in seconds. Which of the following gives the rate at which the area covered by the oil is changing at time <math alttext="t equals 10 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="A, of 11, minus A, of 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>11</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator A, of 10, and denominator 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
